title: Certified Medical Assistant
description: College of Medicine is seeking a Certified Medical Assistant for the Partnership Comprehensive Care Practice.
cleaned_text: Certified Medical Assistant Job no: 500140 Position type: Full-Time Location: Center City Division/Equivalent: DU_Provost-Acad School/Unit: College of Medicine Department/Office: Medicine - HIV Categories: Drexel University, College of Medicine [Apply now](https://secure.dc4.pageuppeople.com/apply/820/gateway/default.aspx?c=apply&lJobID=500140&lJobSourceTypeID=796&sLanguage=en-us) Job Summary The Drexel Partnership Comprehensive Care Practice provides expert primary and specialty healthcare for patients living with HIV. As one of the largest comprehensive HIV primary care practices in the region, the Partnership provides men and women access to a full range of services to meet their medical and emotional needs - regardless of ability to pay. Essential Functions Working under the direct supervision of the practice's clinical manager, employee will interact and care for patients seen in the clinic setting. Employee serves as a member of the care team and supports patient care delivery by performing relevant medical tasks including: - Collecting vital signs - Prepping and cleaning examine rooms - Phlebotomy - Preparing laboratory specimens; performing laboratory tests on the premises - Instrument sterilization - Accurately recording patient information in accordance with EMR documentation guidelines - Performing EKGs and other minor diagnostics/treatments - Administering injections, vaccines, and routine immunizations, - Assisting health care providers during examinations - Disposing of contaminated supplies - Sterilizing medical instruments - Prior authorizations for radiologic studies - Schedule patient appointments in accordance with EMR scheduling guidelines - Works in partnership with clinic team members to ensure patients healthcare needs are being met Maintains patient privacy in accordance with HIPAA guidelines - Maintains medical supply inventory for clinic; keeps patient rooms stocked with supplies as appropriate; ensures expired products are disposed of properly - Quality control testing - All other duties as assigned by leader Required Qualifications - Valid registration/certification as Certified Medical Assistant (CMA) in the State of Pennsylvania or LPN - Strong phlebotomy/venipuncture skills a must - At least 2 years recent experience in primary care Preferred Qualifications - Experience in urgent care or emergent care a plus - Ability to communicate effectively with providers and others to resolve issues - Ability to demonstrate reliability and responsiveness to patients, families, and co-workers - Bilingual (English/Spanish) a plus Physical Demands - Typically standing, walking, bending Location Center City, Philadelphia PA Additional Information This position is classified as Non-Exempt with a grade of H. For more information regarding Drexel's Professional Staff salary structure, [https://drexel.edu/hr/career/ducomp/salstructure/](https://drexel.edu/hr/career/ducomp/salstructure/) Please review the [Benefits Brochure](https://issuu.com/csbcommunications/docs/drexel_ft_staff_benefits_bro_v1?fr=sZDc2YjMyNzYzOTM) for some information on our benefits offerings. Special Instructions to the Applicant Please make sure you upload your CV/resume and cover letter when submitting your application.
